0.user_question: If Martin eats Cheerios every day for breakfast, he'll lose 1.25 pounds/week. If he eats donuts every day for breakfast, he'll gain 1.75 pounds/week. What will be the difference in his weight at the end of 5 weeks between the two breakfast options?

ost_step.1: Eating Cheerios leads him to loss 1.25 pounds per week. In 5 weeks this totals (1.25 * 5) = 6.25 pounds lost.
ost_step.2: Eating Donuts causes him to gain 1.75 pounds each week. Over five weeks that amounts to (1.75 * 5)= 8.75 pounds gained.
ost_step.3: To find out the change over these 5 weeks we take the sum of gains from one option minus losses from another; so it would equal (8.75 – 6.25) = 2.5 pounds.
ost_step.4: Therefore, if he switches back and forth on what breakfast cereal he consumes then after 5 weeks, the overall effect on his bodyweight due to varying diets alone results in additional weight equivalent to approximately 2.5 pounds or about half a kilogram.
